image.title: World News, Today World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News, Trending News of World - Times of India

item.title: ‘Will not walk free in our country again’: Feds plan to deport Kilmar Abrego Garcia for 'horrific crimes'; accused denies charges
item.description: Federal prosecutors have indicated that the Trump administration intends to deport Kilmar Abrego Garcia, charged with human smuggling and alleged MS-13 affiliation, to a country other than El Salvador if he's released from jail. His attorneys are fighting to have him returned to Maryland for his ongoing criminal case, fearing swift deportation by ICE.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ‘We should have had a choice’: Brain-dead pregnant woman in Georgia taken off life support after premature birth; baby weighs 1 Kg
item.description: In Georgia, Adriana Smith, a brain-dead pregnant Black woman, was kept on life support due to state abortion restrictions. After giving birth prematurely to a son, Chance, via emergency C-section, she was removed from life support. The case highlights the impact of strict abortion laws following the overturning of Roe v Wade, particularly affecting Black women facing medical neglect.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'If AI is the reason...': Viral post asks why companies are still asking for H-1Bs
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ‘We are 60’: Michelle on divorce rumors, explains why she's rarely seen with Barack Obama
item.description: Former US First Lady Michelle Obama has addressed rumors about her marriage with Barack Obama, attributing their infrequent public appearances to their age, stating they are "too old for Instagram". She explained her deliberate choice to skip high-profile events, prioritizing personal choices over public expectations. Obama also reflected on scaling back her ambitions as a working mother and first lady.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Jagmeet Singh is target of hate because...': Shocking report reveals steep rise in South Asian hate in Canada
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Investigate Zohran Mamdani if he concealed...' Rep Andy Ogles writes to DOJ, says his rap lyrics were problematic

item.title: ‘Get out of the way’: Overweight passenger dragged off plane in Thailand after demanding aisle seat; flight delayed over an hour
item.description: A British tourist was forcibly removed from a Thai Lion Air flight in Bangkok after demanding an emergency exit seat due to feeling cramped in his original seat. The man's disruptive behavior, including a tantrum and refusal to move, led to police intervention. The incident caused a one-hour delay for the flight's departure from Don Mueang International Airport.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ‘About the worst’: US defense Secy Pete Hegseth rips former Fox News colleague over Iran question - watch
item.description: Defense secretary Pete Hegseth criticized Fox News' Jennifer Griffin for allegedly misrepresenting President Trump's statements regarding the American bombings of Iranian nuclear sites. Griffin questioned the effectiveness of the strikes, specifically at the Fordow facility, prompting Hegseth's sharp rebuke. This follows similar attacks on the media by the Trump administration, who are disputing reports questioning the operation's success.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Just the beginning': Vivek Ramaswamy breaks record in raising fund for Guv election campaign, $8.5 million in five months
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'US strikes caused significant physical damage but ... ': Iran's nuclear program wiped out? What nuclear watchdog chief said
item.description: IAEA chief Rafael Grossi said US strikes caused damage to Iran's nuclear sites. Centrifuges were vulnerable. He denied the program was wiped out, despite claims. Some facilities remained untouched. Iran planned protective measures for enriched uranium. US strikes reduced Iran's nuclear capacities. Reports questioned the strikes' effectiveness. The US dismissed claims of Iran moving uranium before the attack.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'American citizen only for 7 years': Republican Club calls for Zohran Mamdani's deportation, 'He isn't the mayor yet'
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Not everybody could marry Donald Trump': What's the row over Melania Trump's Einstein Visa?
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Burqa-clad Statue of Liberty? MAGA targets Zohran Mamdani’s religion; refers to 9/11
item.description: Zohran Mamdani's apparent victory in the New York City mayoral Democratic primary has sparked Islamophobic reactions from MAGA-aligned figures. Marjorie Taylor Greene shared an altered image of the Statue of Liberty, while others like Nancy Mace invoked 9/11. Critics have also accused Mamdani of antisemitism due to his stance on Israel.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'You won't see': Pentagon shows new footage to counter reports that strikes achieved nothing
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Nothing taken out': Trump on Iran shifting uranium from nuclear sites ahead of US strikes; says 'too dangerous to move'
item.description: Amidst US strikes, reports surfaced alleging Iran moved its uranium stockpile from nuclear sites, a claim President Trump dismissed as impractical, citing concrete work at the shafts. Defense Secretary Hegseth also denied intelligence of any relocation. Experts suggest Iran concealed the uranium, potentially moving 400 kilograms of enriched material before inspections halted, leaving its current location unknown.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'They have a choice..': Usha Vance on what religion their children follow; 'Hindu rituals part of their life'
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump’s tariff wars deal a blow! US economy shrinks 0.5%; worse than estimates
item.description: The US economy contracted by 0.5% in the first quarter of 2025, primarily due to a surge in imports spurred by President Trump's trade war. This import surge, up 37.9%, significantly dragged down GDP, marking the first quarterly decline in three years. Despite the downturn, economists anticipate a rebound in the second quarter, projecting a 3% growth.
item.dc:creator: TOI Business Desk

item.title: NYC Mayoral Race 2025: Decoding Indian-origin politics of Zohran Mamdani - through his father's books
item.description: A towering figure in postcolonial scholarship, Mahmood is not your typical academic. Born in Bombay (now Mumbai), raised in Kampala, exiled during Idi Amin’s regime, and now based at Columbia University, he has spent his life dissecting the violent architecture of the modern world. His work explores colonialism, genocide, citizenship, and the political construction of identity.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
